icd3

Interface MayanDate<T extends MayanDate<T>>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CalendarRoundDate, CyclicDate, HaabDate, LongCountDate, TzolkinDate

    public interface MayanDate<T extends MayanDate<T>>
    An immutable data structure to represent a date in different Mayan calendars. The date representation is only comparable with other date representations of the same type.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Determines whether this date is equivalent to another date of the same type.
      int minus(T other)
      Calculate the difference between this date and another date of the same type.
      T plus(int days)
      Calculate a certain number of days away from this date.
      int toInt()
      Gives the internal integer representation of this date.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Gives the String representation of this date.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Determines whether this date is equivalent to another date of the same type.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - Another date of the same type with which to compare.
        Returns:
        True if o is a non-null MayanDate of the same type that represents the same equivalence class.

      • minus

        int minus(T other)
        Calculate the difference between this date and another date of the same type.
        Parameters:
        other - The other date of the same type.
        Returns:
        The difference between the two dates. In an absolute date system (such as the Long Count), minus MAY return a negative. However, in a cyclic system (such as the Tzolkin), minus SHOULD return the positive equivalence class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If other is null.

      • plus

        T plus(int days)
        Calculate a certain number of days away from this date.
        Parameters:
        days - The number of days to add (can be negative for subtract). If days is 0, this will return itself.
        Returns:
        A date object that is shifted from this date.

      • toInt

        int toInt()
        Gives the internal integer representation of this date.
        Returns:
        The integer representation of this date.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Gives the String representation of this date.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The String representation of this date.
